abstract: There was a big reaction (both in the markets and on DealBook) to Friday’s report on General Electric from analysts at Citigroup, who suggested that a partial breakup of the conglomerate could help its stock break out of its multiyear rut. Some DealBook readers, like Motley Fool’s Nathan Parmelee, commented on the irony that the report came from Citi, a financial giant that some shareholders and investors have also said could benefit from a breakup.
lead_paragraph: There was a big reaction (both in the markets and on DealBook) to Friday’s report on General Electric from analysts at Citigroup, who suggested that a partial breakup of the conglomerate could help its stock break out of its multiyear rut. Some DealBook readers, like Motley Fool’s Nathan Parmelee, commented on the irony that the report came from Citi, a financial giant that some shareholders and investors have also said could benefit from a breakup.

headline.main: More G.E. Musings: Who Would Buy NBC?
